titleStmt.title: The penniles parliament of threed-bare poets: or, All mirth and wittie conceites
Jacke of Dover, his quest of inquirie, or his privy search for the veriest foole in England. Part 2.

publicationStmt.publisher: For William Barley, and are to be sold at his shoppe in Gratious streete neere Leaden-hall gate,

notesStmt.note: Originally published in 1604 as part 2 of: Jacke of Dover, his quest of inquirie, or his privy search for the veriest foole in England.
Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shoppe in Gratious streete neere Leaden-hall gate
